codes.description: The level of sophistication and intricacy involved in the dynamic task decomposition algorithm used by Manis.
Refers to the specific application of the algorithm in managing and organizing tasks effectively.
Highlights the advanced nature of the algorithm as a representation of technological progress in task decomposition.
The extent to which the system allows users to see and understand its components and functionalities.
The degree of control that users have over the system and its components.
codes.exemplar: user control letting users directly inspect

codes.description: The ability for users to modify the system to better meet their needs.
codes.exemplar: customize or replace individual sub agents

codes.description: Refers to the modular components within the system that can be manipulated by the user.
The integration of various tools and technologies that enhance the system's functionality as perceived by the user.

groupings.rationale: This grouping captures the technical aspects of the system, focusing on the complexity of the algorithm and its innovative application in managing tasks.
This grouping emphasizes the user-centric features of the system, highlighting how transparency, control, and customization enable users to interact with and adapt the system to their needs.
